data.title: Soviet and Post-Soviet Studies
data.meta_description: Open access academic research from top universities on the subject of Soviet and Post-Soviet Studies
data.text:
Comparing The Us Response To The Soviet Invasion Of Afghanistan And The Russian Invasion Of Ukraine: Learning From The Past And Planning For The Future, Zachary Hogan University of Denver

Displaced Ukrainian Writers After 2014, A Postcolonial Perspective, Sophie Ivanka Shields Dartmouth College

Echoes Of War In Lithuania, Jokubas Salyga The University of Texas Rio Grande Valley

Media Framing Of The Russian Invasion Of Ukraine: An Analysis Of The Tv Program 'Evening With Vladimir Solovyov', Hellen Petrovskaya Fordham University

Framing Identity: Russian Media In The Baltics As A Mechanism Of Soft Power, Jackson McArthur University of Mississippi

Too Little, Too Late: The Icc And The Politics Of Prosecutorial Procrastination In Georgia, Marco Bocchese Webster Vienna Private University

The Place Of Nuclear Weapons In Russian Identity: An Ontological Security Analysis, Peter Ernest Yeager Old Dominion University

“Genocide Of The Soviet People”: Putin’S Russia Waging Lawfare By Means Of History, 2018–2023, Anton Weiss-Wendt The Norwegian Center for Holocaust and Minority Studies, Oslo

Russian Chemical And Biological Weapons: Limiting The Effects Of Russian Cbw Programs On Nato Security Through 2035, Jason Gregory Porter Missouri State University

Emerging From Behind The Curtain: A Comparative Analysis Of Polish And Czech Reforms Based On Quality Of Life Improvements, Summer Ellis Claremont Colleges

Rabbi Mordukh Krol: “Little Man” In The Background Of The Soviet Epoch, Tetiana Savchuk Zaporizhzhia National University, Zaporizhzhia, Ukraine

War, Remembrance, And Katýn: How Public Memory Sites Affirm National Identity, Adele Partington Dominican University of California

(Non)Synagogues In Slovakia, Peter Salner Slovak Academy of Sciences, Bratislava, Slovakia

Research In A Closed Political Context, Covid, And Across Languages: Methodological Lessons, Messages, And Ideas, Darzhan Kazbekova, Rebecca Schewe, Davor Mondom Syracuse University

Behind Russia’S Invasion Of Ukraine: The Clash Of Different Mode Of Capitalism, Nandito Oktaviano, Agussalim Burhanuddin Hasanuddin University

Constructions Of Greatness In Foreign Policy: Neo-Ottomanism In Türki̇ye And Eurasianism In Russia, Jonathan Jordan, Salwa Azzahra Department of International Relations, Universitas Indonesia

“Comrade Woman” In 21st-Century Serbia: (Dis)Continuities Of Yugoslav Feminism In Post-Yugoslav, Post-War Serbian Feminism, Heyu Yuan SIT Study Abroad

Religion And Atheism In Everyday Day Life Of The Ukrainian Educators In The 1920s-1930s, Oleksandr Lukyanenko, Vitaly Dmytrenko, Vita Dmytrenko Poltava V. G. Korolenko National Pedagogical University

Models Of Social Activity Of Protestant Churches In The Context Of Russia's Military Aggression Against Ukraine, Ihor Lutsan Yuriy Fedkovych Chernivtsi National University, Chernivtsi, Ukraine
